body_html:
Ok, compiling with gcc-4.9 seems to work. Closing since I'm pretty sure this was a compiler issue which I believe is explicitly not supported by cuda 8.0 (ie. gcc 5.4.1).

Sorry for not trying that before posting here. I assumed it would work since I thought it was the same compiler as before the upgrade. Also apologies for the slow follow up.

Regarding the question, I don't believe it was specific to fake_quant_ops_gpu.cu.cc but rather was triggered from the first gpu op the encountered (ex. gru_ops_gpu.cu.cc, l2loss_op_gpu.cu.cc).

Thank you for the quick response.

body:
Ok, compiling with gcc-4.9 seems to work. Closing since I'm pretty sure this was a compiler issue which I believe is explicitly not supported by cuda 8.0 (ie. gcc 5.4.1). 

Sorry for not trying that before posting here. I assumed it would work since I thought it was the same compiler as before the upgrade. Also apologies for the slow follow up.

Regarding the question, I don't believe it was specific to fake_quant_ops_gpu.cu.cc but rather was triggered from the first gpu op the encountered (ex. gru_ops_gpu.cu.cc, l2loss_op_gpu.cu.cc).

Thank you for the quick response.
